FuncDef:
The mpls mldp p2mp bfd-trigger-tunnel all command configures a policy for dynamically establishing a BFD session to monitor an mLDP P2MP tunnel.
The undo mpls mldp p2mp bfd-trigger-tunnel all command deletes a policy for dynamically establishing a BFD session to monitor an mLDP P2MP tunnel.
By default, no trigger policy is configured.
CLIs: undo mpls mldp p2mp bfd-trigger-tunnel all
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
BFD for mLDP P2MP tunnel applies to NG-MVPNs and VPLS networks on which mLDP P2MP trees with primary and backup roots are configured. If a P2MP tunnel fails, BFD for mLDP P2MP tunnel rapidly detects the fault and switches traffic to the backup tunnel, which reduces traffic loss and improves fault convergence performance in an NG-MVPN over mLDP P2MP scenario or a VPLS over mLDP P2MP scenario. After dynamic for mLDP P2MP tunnel is enabled using the mpls mldp bfd enable command, run the mpls mldp p2mp bfd-trigger-tunnel all command to configure a policy for dynamically establishing a BFD session to monitor an nLDP P2MP tunnel.
The configured policy takes effect on all mLDP P2MP tunnels that are established using host routes.
Prerequisites
The MPLS view has been displayed using the mpls command.
